items.content:
#â€‹552 â€” August 20, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Ruby on Rails' Creator on Modern Web Apps without JS Bundling or Transpiling â€” David Heinemeier Hansson (the original creator of the popular Ruby on Rails framework) has explained where he sees the future of JavaScript in Rails-based apps and it involves using import maps and not needing bundlers like Webpacker â€“ instead apps will just pull in the ES modules needed. He also shows off how it works in this 27-minuteÂ screencast.

David Heinemeier Hansson (DHH)

An Absurd Future for SQL on the Web? â€” absurd-sql is a project aiming to provide a persistent backend for SQLite on the web. It uses IndexedDB but with sql.js in front so you can use SQLite in a natural but persisted way from webapps. Some interesting thoughtsÂ here.

James Long

Learn the Fundamentals of TypeScript â€” Use TypeScript to add strong typing to large JavaScript apps helps reduce bugs and keeps code performant and maintainable. This course covers all you need to know including how to migrate your codebase to TypeScript and improve productivity while building large-scale apps withÂ ease.

items.title: Vue Components as Custom Elements with Vue 3.2
items.content:
#â€‹551 â€” August 13, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Vue 3.2 Released â€” Some new features for single file components, significant perf improvements, and itâ€™s now easy to define native custom elements with defineCustomElement (learn more about this in Vue Components as Custom Elements â€“ this could be a big deal for many).

Evan You

'JavaScript Needs More Helper Functions for Iteration' â€” Many languages have a plethora of functions or methods for iteration, but many of JavaScriptâ€™s options came late and scoped to particular data types (such as Array's new methods in ES6) and Axel thinks we need to go a lot further while comparing a variety ofÂ approaches.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Get Started with JavaScript and InfluxDBÂ 2.0 â€” How-to guide to monitor your JavaScript application performance and create beautiful web-based visualizations with InfluxDB time seriesÂ platform.

InfluxData sponsor

V8 Release v9.3 â€” Recent V8 releases have been reasonably lean on new features, and so it goes with 9.3 which mostly gets faster compilation, Object.hasOwn (an alias for Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call), and the ability to attach error â€˜causesâ€™ to Error instances. Itâ€™s in beta until Chrome 93 (due in the coming weeks) and will appear in Node.js soonÂ too.

Ingvar Stepanyan

Next.js 11.1 Released â€” The popular React framework takes a few steps forward with experimental ES modules support, a new integration with swc to ultimately replace JS tooling (Babel and Terser), faster data mapping and source maps, andÂ more.
